Reviews.Title: “Laughably Bad. Fraud is really the word.”
Reviews.Author: mayorq
Reviews.Content: My sister and her husband rented it for his 60th birthday and wanted to put up friends and family. In fairness, the location is awesome. No doubt about that. That's the only nice thing I can say. Some of the problems- The bathrooms were not all functioning. There was no table, the main bedroom bed was broken. the majority of the rooms are tiny cubicles off a main hall with sliding glass doors. The effect is very "prison". The "caretaker" lives in a room that is really PART OF THE APARTMENT. She was perfectly nice, but we were sharing the bathroom with her. The apartment is not as large as advertised. Directly downstairs is a dance studio, and on the weekend they had a salsa dance party that was pretty cute, but kept us up until 4am. we made the best of it, and there were awesome things about the neighborhood, but the place is a scam.

Reviews.Title: “This Loft was AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: thebestguest
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Soho Loft with 8 of my friends for an engagement party. My stay here was absolutely amazing. Each of my friends and I slept comfortably at night and were able to Party at night! Everything was clean and renovated and I felt right at home. I would highly recommend this space for any type of event!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with group!!”
Reviews.Author: AussieAl21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Soho Loft about a month ago and had a wonderful time! I was traveling with 10 friends and it was between this or a 3 star hotel we found in midtown so we decided to change it up a bit. The loft is in the most amazing part of Manhattan! If you are not familiar with Soho it is the prime location, great food, fashion, nightlife and easy to get everywhere. I would def suggest staying here if you are coming to Manhattan with a group of friends!

Reviews.Title: “True New York Experience!”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover121
Reviews.Content: For those of us who know New York City it is quite hard to find a quality place to stay that is in a great location, without spending a fortune! I came across The Soho Loft and booked it for a few of my friends who were coming in from out of town. The loft was extremely affordable, in the best part of the city and really a true New York Experience!

Reviews.Title: “SOOOOO BAD!!! Absolutely Gross!”
Reviews.Author: BostonNoThanks
Reviews.Content: The worst accommodations I have ever seen. The bedrooms were closets without windows. Incredibly hot and noisy. I slept on a towel rather than in the bed. Bathrooms were in very poor shape. Common area was not even close to as pictured! Little furniture and lots of dirty dishes. This was just BAD BAD BAD!! Never again. I am still shuddering when I think about it. DIRTY! Run down! Poorly appointed! Nothing good to say. Police station across the street was a noise factory. I just cannot believe how bad it all was.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Shady Unprofessional Place”
Reviews.Author: Princessdog9
Reviews.Content: Please note that I have not stayed here yet. My experience is based on the pre stay experience I had with this company. My stay was supposed to be Oct 5-11 2008 I booked this Loft because 1st- was in Soho, 2nd the pictures looked good, 3rd the price was good, 4- I was contacted immediately. I never should have done it. They require you prepay on a credit card and sign a "lease." I should have known better by the tone of the emails. Unprofessional, Lacking in tact or intelligently written. The terms of the contract are short. Basically (but vaguely) It says cancelation policy is within outside of 6 weeks prior to the stay a refund of 75% will be given back if re-rented. I didn't think we'd cancel. Well, after reading all of the horrible reviews on Trip Advisor and other sites - I canceled. I immediately emailed the 2 people I dealt with told them about the reviews. One review stated that they actually book private partys in the "commom" space and they can go all night. The guests aren't allowed to be in that space during the party. As well it said, the party guests use the same bathrooms as the overnight guests. Plus, the rooms do not lock. One reviewer even said the day he arrived his bed had been used and sheets were not changed. Gross! This was not the mature, private, clean and comfortable arrangement I wanted. In my cancelation letter I mentioned and asked if there would be parties booked. I recieved confirmation that there could be a party booked. I was contacted not by the original people who took care of me( we'll call them kevin/sales and James/rental agreeme\nt)But by the Director of the Loft. After some correspondence, the Director, we'll call him Leroy, stated that he might have a private apt. I was very much interested in it and wanted details. It would be easier to just change locations instead of cancel. He didn/t get back to me. I had to be the one to initiate all communication each and ever time. Plus it took 3 or 4 emails to get him to answer. He finally, after a week said he found a place. I wanted details. After 3 days, still no details. He kept sending one sentence emails like "don't worry" etc etc. After 4 emails and 3 days of asking, I finally emailed and stated that I wanted the address and details of the place by end of day. He emailed back and said" don't worrry, call me at lunchtime tomorrow" I did what he said - he answered the phone and put me off.. again. He said he was busy and to call him around closing time. I agreed. However after all of the correspondence, unprofessional behavior, abrupt and strange emails, I decided to cancel. His response?: "No problem" I had since sent 2 emails asking the status of my refund. No reply. I have a feeling even if they did re-rent my space - I may not see my money. Very very shady. by the way, this location was found through VacationRentals.com which in itself does not have a good reputation according to reviews. Do yourself a favor, stay at a well known reputable hotel. It's worth it. As of now, I have booked a hotel for the week and will have to shell out another 2000K. The Soho Loft cost 299 per night plus tax.. ugh.

Reviews.Title: “over promised, over charged.”
Reviews.Author: meisaak
Reviews.Content: Beware. The property manager (who lives with you in the space) will change any agreement at anytime. We were promised breakfast every morning which she decided not to do. We were promised that we could leave our bags in the space after check out time because most of our group was leaving in the evening. She decided that would not work for her. We were promised housekeeping, which NEVER occured. She disabled out internet half way throught the stay...Unfortunately, we paid in full, in advance. And she could change the key lock at anytime and lock us out of our space. Though the space wasn't exactly what was portrayed in the images posted, the space worked just fine for us. It was the horrible woman that runs the loft made us unhappy with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware!”
Reviews.Author: NWRambler
Reviews.Content: The Soho Loft is a “B&B” by only the most limited definition and only if you plan on being there between 1 am and 3 pm. My husband’s first reaction was that the loft had been a former massage parlor. I have no idea where the people giving positive reviews of this place stayed. Our bedroom was a shabby, stuffy, 6X10 windowless room that barely fit the bed and a bowed dresser. The fan in the room made so much noise that we couldn’t sleep. The walls are paper thin. Both nights we stayed, the loft also hosted parties of 30 - 100+ people starting at 5:30. We found out about the parties AFTER we arrived, and that the common room, (the pictures of it on the website was the reason that we booked the place), would be off limits to us until at least midnight. We were also warned to keep our room doors locked in case any of the party guests tried to get in. We also shared our bathroom with all the party guests. Good luck with finding toilet paper. Breakfast was Costco muffins, and dry cereal. The other guests arriving during our stay were as surprised and none stayed a second night. Management was unresponsive and rude. On requesting a partial refund, we were informed they had no refund policy and that their information to us had “clearly” indicated the loft was a ‘multi-purpose facility’. However, the website didn’t indicate parties occurred during guest stays, no mention of them had been made at the time we booked our reservations (or we wouldn’t have booked), and the “welcome letter” (received after we left for NYC) mentioned that on occasion the common areas would be off limits due to other events; inferring rare and not five nights in a row. Management responded, “It’s the holiday season, what else did you expect?” Ken, the sales rep, also stated a refund was unreasonable because we had actually stayed there, offering no good reply when I asked what our alternative was when arriving for the weekend before Christmas. The best they could offer was a free night on our next visit in the loft where we had spent a miserable time. NO THANKS!

Reviews.Title: “Your room is for storage, not people”
Reviews.Author: usawear
Reviews.Content: This place is terrible. 2 bathrooms for 7 sliding glass door storage rooms, and only one has hot water. No windows in room, suffocating heat. The Chinese woman who ran it was mean. The finger print door mechanism took 10 times to work. Someone is making a killing with their misleading website. Its better to sleep on the street.

Reviews.Title: “More like a hostel than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: dntla
Reviews.Content: I recommend this place for those who are comfortable with hostels. You might think of it as a place where you'd live if you were new to Manhattan and didn't have much money: - The rooms are small with no windows. - There's no housekeeping. - You might have to wait for a bathroom, there might not be hot water and some of the plumbing could be broken. - The space may be used to host an event; you're expected to leave or stay in your room. - It's very loud, due to the hardwood floors, thin walls, and the dance studio downstairs. The biggest positive: the staff seemed fairly eager to please. Note: This review is for Soho Loft at 199 Lafayette, whereas some of the other reviews seem to be for the unrelated Soho Loft at 153 Lafayette.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: LAtravelers007
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here! This place is a disaster waiting to happen. We spent 5 long nights here in September. The guest rooms are tiny little spaces built out without windows, air, proper lighting, and any regard for inhabitation. The construction is scary; electrical wires without protective conduit, registers without air duct connections, a sliding glass door entry with a high threshold (a tripping hazard) NO LOCKS, 2 shared dirty bathrooms with exposed wires and hot water ONLY in one bathroom at a time. Additionally, one of the bathrooms had to have the hot water faucet in the sink running in order for the shower to work. The pictures taken on this website in the public areas do show the design intent, although most of the wonderful furniture pieces photographed weren’t there. The rooms shown are gravely misrepresented. The “red” room is the only room with a real closet. The rest have cheap wardrobe boxes or hangers mounted on the wall, and one has an electrical/data closet being used as a closet. Each room has a double bed against one wall, thus the poor person sleeping against the wall has a challenge getting to the bathroom at night. One of the rooms has a tiny path around the bed, which a small child would struggle navigating around. I don't understand how some of these reviews could be good. They must have stayed at a different place.

Reviews.Title: “incredibly convenient”
Reviews.Author: missgray
Reviews.Content: I went to the Soho Loft overnight for a business event in the area and found the experience to be really convenient for me. Some of the rooms are smaller than others, but it's not an uptown hotel, it's a downtown bed and breakfast. It's great if you're going to be in and out of town and just need a comfortable place to stay. I do plan on staying in the loft for future NY business visits.

Reviews.Title: “Loved being in NYC, which felt like my own LOFT”
Reviews.Author: JRO79
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Soho Loft was a wonderful experience. The people working there were extremely friendly. They made excellent restaurant recommendations and I felt like I was actually living in NYC. I would definately recommend this accomadation to friends, family and my business associates.

Reviews.Title: “Call this the "SoBad Loft," "SoHell Loft" or "SoHole Loft"”
Reviews.Author: SteveKDE
Reviews.Content: The writer who gave this hovel a rating of "5" was probably confusing it with another place called SoHo Loft a block or two south of this hole. My wife and I stayed at the SoHole Loft (the one at 199 Lafayette) the weekend of 10/5-10/7/07. We have done a great deal of traveling and have stayed at some of the best hotels and at some of the worst, but never have we encountered anything like this place. It was like a prison. The proprietess never cracked a smile, never said hello, and seemed very unhappy to be there. And who can blame her? Our bed was never made after our first night there, we had to ask for towels, the room itself was dank, poorly lit and had no ventilation (and no windows). Nor did any of the other rooms as far as we could tell. To get hot water in the shower, you had to keep the hot water faucet in the sink going. Lighting was...almost nonexistent! Our first night there, we overhead one "guest" (inmate) screaming at the proprietess, threatening to sue for fraud. I almost asked to join her in a class action suit. Really...this place was simply awful.

Reviews.Title: “soho loft rooms are not fit for humans”
Reviews.Author: NYfan_7
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 5 nights. The main problem was there is NO LIGHT AND NO AIR to the bedrooms. They are dark stuffy closets that made us claustrophobic and depressed. Some guests came, took one look and ran screaming, while we had paid up in full and thought we'd stick it out. There may be functions on during your stay, and you can't use the communal spaces when they are on. And if you're jet-lagged like we were it was torture lying in our hot room listening to constant party noise when we just needed to sleep. Don't be seduced by the pictures on the website: there has been a new room built that fills in a big part of the open space, and the bedrooms are really not fit for humans, I don't know how they have gotten some positive reviews. The kitchen and lounge are great but their style, light and air do not reach the bedrooms. Stay somewhere else in the area and enjoy new york properly.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous, intriguing place”
Reviews.Author: r0odboy
Reviews.Content: Dream your dream of a Soho loft and then multiply by 2 and you have this place. It has charm, character, location, light, great design touches. I can't stop thinking of reasons to get back to New York so I can stay there again. One of best things is location, location, location - right at the hub of the village, Little Italy, and Soho, with good neighborhood restaurants all around, very hip, trendy spots just down the street, cabs streaming by at any hour, subways a block away...A perfect spot.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Bohemian Chic”
Reviews.Author: 1970Shanghai
Reviews.Content: If you want a bit of bohemia and experience New York like a New Yorker, The Soho Loft is my hands on recommendation and my favorite place to stay in New York....

Reviews.Title: “BEST deal in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: edavidenn
Reviews.Content: saw it on the internet...LOTS OF FUN! very social...really good for the extended stay traveler...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastTraveler32
Reviews.Content: The place was absolutely fantastic. The decor was charming, the staff was extremely courteous and helpful, and the rooms were very comfortable. I loved having my own DirectTV in my room, and the location is absolutely magnificent. The place was huge!! With Hotel prices triple the price, it really was a steal.
